body_html:
Just changing the ld symlink from x86_64-linux-gnu-ld to x86_64-linux-gnu-ld.gold crashes with

error: undefined reference to 'tanhf'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

Besides that, just changing the symlink was a good idea for testing purposes, but I don't really feel good about doing that permanently.

Any idea how to modify the flag in the build_def.bzl file? If I just remove it, I get another error.
body_text:
Just changing the ld symlink from x86_64-linux-gnu-ld to x86_64-linux-gnu-ld.gold crashes with
error: undefined reference to 'tanhf'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status

Besides that, just changing the symlink was a good idea for testing purposes, but I don't really feel good about doing that permanently.
Any idea how to modify the flag in the build_def.bzl file? If I just remove it, I get another error.
body:
Just changing the ld symlink from `x86_64-linux-gnu-ld` to `x86_64-linux-gnu-ld.gold` crashes with
```
error: undefined reference to 'tanhf'
collect2: error: ld returned 1 exit status
```
Besides that, just changing the symlink was a good idea for testing purposes, but I don't really feel good about doing that permanently.

Any idea how to modify the flag in the `build_def.bzl` file? If I just remove it, I get another error.
